com.pb.sawdust.util.collections.cache

Class ReferenceCache<K,V,RK extends java.lang.ref.Reference<K>,RV extends java.lang.ref.Reference<V>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.collections.cache.ReferenceCache<K,V,RK,RV>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cache<K,V>, java.util.Map<K,V>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SoftCache, WeakCache

    public abstract class ReferenceCache<K,V,RK extends java.lang.ref.Reference<K>,RV extends java.lang.ref.Reference<V>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cache<K,V>
    The ReferenceCache class defines a cache which holds references (in the java.lang.ref.Reference sense) to its keys and values. These references may be garbage collected despite their use in the cache, which can be useful for cache maintenance based on object scoping or memory-sensitive situations. When one of the references is garbage collected, it will be removed (along with its value) from the cache. To prevent aggresive cache cleaning, a specified "strong" cache limit is used which defines the minimum number of key-value pairs in the cache. As long as the key-value pair count is below this limit, none of the cache elements will be removed. Once it is exceeded, then the least-recently referenced keys beyond the cache limit are no longer "protected" by the cache and open for garbage collection (which also may depend on external references).
